info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 3:52AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL BENTON AND NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 352 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles south of Tontitown, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Lowell... Tontitown... Bethel Heights... Johnson... Elm Springs... Goshen... Mayfield... Wheeler... Sonora... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 60 and 78. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
